Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, It has been almost 11 months since my Radical Robotic Prostatectomy performed by Dr. David Samadi @ Lennox Hill Hospital in NYC. My incontinence is gone completely. I have one major issue and that is I get a terrible, severe pain in my large hip muscles in my but and surrounding area when I get "Aroused" and I start to get an erection. It feels like a wave of pain that is like a "Brain Freeze" but in my hips, all across my backside. I don't this pain any other times except when I am getting a stimulated erection. I have type II diabetes and maybe it is neuropathy pain? This pain is so severe that I stops me from having a natural erection. Has anyone experienced this pain condition??? What are your experiences and what have you done to treat this??? FrankP
Posts.Title: Arousal Pain In My Hips when starting an Erection

Posts.Content: Dear Masbirdies & Friends, Yes, I mentioned this to my Urologist about 3 months ago and he put me on Tamsulosin 0.04 mg (low dose Alpha Blocker to help the orgasm pain but I it has not improved. My erections can happen if aroused but the Arousal pain stops the process. It is a Tingling Pain like getting a "Brain Freeze" in my Hips!!!! it is a very odd condition. I only get it when I am getting aroused. I have looked into it further and I found that it could be Bursitis in the hip muscles. I get all across my hips in the big muscle groups. I don't get the pain at my penis nor at the surgery area, just all across my hips and some into my thighs. It is like an anxiety attack. FrankP
Posts.Title: Arousal Pain In My Hips when starting an Erection

Posts.Title: Arousal Pain In My Hips when starting an Erection

Posts.Content: Hello, I strongly suggest the Kegel Exercises as soon as possible after surgery. I will be at 6 months since my surgery come Monday Morning! The incontinence is almost 100% gone now. The ED is very much a work in progress and I really do not have any sensation. I go back to my Psychologist on Wed. this week my second visit. I urge anyone having difficulties dealing with the changes to you body and coping with how your body has changed, to go to talk to a health professional and get it all off your chest. The burden of coping is very overwhelming and the Stress is unbearable. I have some "ok" moments but most of the time it is very very hard to deal with. I have read what many have said that it takes time. That is the hardest part. I will take months if not years to recover fully. I see my Urologist on the 24th. I will bring him up to speed as to what I have been going through and what help I have sought. FrankP
Posts.Title: I'm Coping with Post-Surgery Changes

Posts.Content: Hi Guys, I went to speak to a Psychologist tonight. We spoke 2 hours about everything. It was good to talk to someone that wanted to listen and that understood the Entire Anxiety, Sadness and Mental Emotional Pain I am going through after my Prostate Cancer Surgery. I told him about all of the stresses in my life and my fear and anxiety of not being able to perform and be the same person I was before the Surgery. I told him that for me, it has been very difficult to understand that I am not the same as I was before the Surgery and that the Scars on my stomach Remind me every day of what I have been through. We all have this situation to face, to deal with and to cope with. We have fears of not being able to be a man for our lover. I know I have this fear of not being able to perform for my Girlfriend who is 12 years younger than me and I worry about my longer term future with the condition and that the Cancer may come back. It is about 6 months now and my incontinance is about 100% gone now. I have been told by doctors and people posting that I am still early into my recovery and Patience is the most important thing to keep in mind and sexual function can and will return. I have been going out of my mind these last few months and I have looked for anything to get a spark or a positive response to make myself believe I am getting better. I was at my Cardiologist yesterday and he said that much of the problem is in my head and that I have to relex and give it time. So with that in mind, I urge anyone having problems coping and dealing with the Post Cancer Surgery Stress to talk to someone, your Doctor or a Psychologist and know that it Does help and it Does give you hope for a recovery. I thank all of you for all your Support, FrankP
Posts.Title: I'm Coping with Post-Surgery Changes

Posts.Content: I am a 52 year old, white male. Currently 5'-10, 212 lbs. in good muscular body shape. I Broke my back in car accident when I was 23 causing a compression fracture of (T-9, T-12 & L-1). At 39, diagnosed with Type 2 Diabetes (blood sugar 779 / Triglycerides over 2000 / very high blood pressue & always fighting to keep my blood sugar down! At 51, diagnosed with Prostate Cancer and had my Prostate CAncer Surgery on September 15, 2014! I am a Prostate Cancer Patient and had my Robotic Radical Prostatectomy surgery on September 15, 2014 @ Lennox Hill Hospital with Dr. David Samadi performing the surgery using the Da Vinci Robot. He is quite frankly, THE BEST! The Prostate Cancer Surgery took about 2 hours and I was in the recovery room for about a few hours after that. I woke up with the Catheter in place and I spent one night in the hospital. I went home at about 4:00 PM the next day. Dr. Samadi's private Hospital Wing at Lennox Hill Hospital is a marvel of an Ultra Clean Environment with the most advanced Technology. His Hospital Staff was Exceptionally Warm, Comforting, Soothing and very attentive to my needs. I can not say enough about Dr. Samadi and his supporting Staff. He and his Staff are the best! Original PSA : 8.9. Came down to 5.6 prior to Biopsy. Biopsy found 25% Prostate Cancer. Gleason Scores : 3+4=7 & 4+3=7 Post-Op Pathology : Cancer found to be 42% of Prostate involved all contained inside Prostate. Seminal Vesicles, Lymph Nodes and Margins : ALL NEGATIVE! 1st Post-Op PSA (Nov. 2014) = 0.01 (Undetectables) 2nd Post-Op PSA (Feb. 2014) = 0.02 (Undetectable) The Surgery and the healing went well. Very small amount of blood in urine the first few weeks and then bleeding stropped. Had incontinence the first 3 months after surgery. Now at about 5 1/2 months, the Incontinence is about 98% resolved and I stopped using "Depend Thin Shields" at about 4 1/2 months. At about 3 months or so I started to have very bad Anxiety and sadness. Mentally I have been feeling that my biggest fear and dread of the Erectile Dysfunction will not get better! I had false hopes that things were getting better and that I would return to my former state prior to the Prostate Cancer Surgery. I have had a false impression of the reality of my condition. Now at almost 6 months, I have decided to seek out an Oncology Counselor to help me cope with and deal with my "Changed" physical and mental Condition. I do not feel myself anymore and it is very hard to deal with this and it has been difficult to cope with the many other health issues I have. I will keep you informed as to how my condition progresses. Yours truly, Frank P.
